body.name: SAMSUNG T9 Portable SSD 1TB, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 External Solid State Drive, Seq. Read Speeds Up to 2,000MB/s for Gaming, Students and Professionals, MU-PG1T0B/AM, Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 8 hrs 21 mins.
features: NONSTOP SPEED: Race through projects with our fastest SSD for creators; Load, edit and transfer with sustained read and write speeds of up to 2,000MB/s1; The T9 Portable SSD performs at high speeds even during longer processes

DYNAMIC THERMAL GUARD: When you’re elbow-deep in a passion project, the T9 Portable SSD stays cool; Its advanced thermal solution withstands and controls heat to keep the SSD at ideal temperatures—even in heavy use2

ADAPTS TO EVERY NEED: Whether you’re using a desktop, camera or a gaming console3, count on the T9 Portable SSD for extensive compatibility; It’s a true team player when it comes to heavy-duty application usage or file-saving
STRONG. SOLID. STABLE: From concept to completion – the T9 Portable SSD gives you the longevity to last through heavy use with one convenient drive that dares to go the distance

WORKS LIKE MAGIC: Your T9 Portable SSD performs like new with the always up-to-date Magician Software; With firmware updates, extra encryption and continual monitoring of your drive health, it works like a charm

WORLD’S #1 FLASH MEMORY BRAND: Performance and reliability from the world’s #1 brand for flash memory since 20034; All firmware and components are produced in-house, including our world renowned DRAM and NAND, for quality and you can trust
SUPPORTS iPHONE: Supports iPhone 15 Pro Res 4K at 60fps video and more5; Included SSD cable recommended
body.description: Add power to all your projects with up to 2,000 MB/s transfer speeds1—stellar performance fast enough to for the tasks that matter most. With up to 4TB capacity, the T9 Portable SSD offers plenty of storage space making it a safe bet for capturing all your creative endeavors. 1Performance may vary depending on host configuration. To reach maximum sequential read/write speeds of up to 2,000 MB/s, respectively, the host device and connection cables must support USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 and the UASP mode must be enabled. Test system configuration: ASUS ROG STRIX Z590-E GAMING WIFI, Intel i9-10900K CPU @ 3.70GHz, 3696 MHz, 10 Core(s), 20 Logical Processor(s) / DDR4 8GB DRAM frequency1132.3 MHz / Win 11 Pro. 2T9 maintains skin temperatures below 140oF at all times in controlled conditions (i.e. internal quality test for heat management and safety), in compliance with IEC 62368-1 standard. 3Host device compatibility may vary. 4Source: 2003-2022 OMDIA data: NAND suppliers' revenue market share. 5Included SSD cable recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great External SSD
reviews.reviewText: This is a very fast SSD! I like how small and durable it is too. No issues formating and works perfectly for fast transferring and storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High reliability and performance at a good price.
reviews.reviewText: This type of external SSD (1TB here) is used for portable project file backup and transfer between computers.Factors for why I selected the Samsung T9 Pro:* Physically robust construction. Very protective shock shell around the main drive body for absorbing drops,* Thermally robust operation- good internal heat sinking, to safely support high speed USB3 file transfers on USBC- some other brands of SSD, like the standard SanDisk drives I have bought through Amazon have literally burned out transferring large blocks of files. The Samsung Thermal guard works in action as claimed, in my experience with high speed connections and large data sets.* The speed claims seem quite real; this is the fastest external drive I have tested. It's used mainly on a Mac Studio Max computer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable & Fast Solid State Drive
reviews.reviewText: Samsung has delivered once again. I have used a 1TB SSD T7 for years now and finally decided to upgrade to this T9 and I couldn’t be happier. Speed increase of almost 1,000mbs and the price was excellent.Solid build quality from a solid company.I absolutely recommend this product to anyone who needs or wants to add some more SSD storage space without having to hassle with a PC case. Also this is a great product to increase the storage of a laptop!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great portable SSD
reviews.reviewText: Works perfect! Very fast and compact!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: i bought wrong capacity and had to switch to HDD so I only had it plugged in for a moment but it formatted NTFS ok, speeds were as expected, and it was returned after deleting the partition I made. this cleared on the preloaded Samsung content so hopefully that is restored during refurb. would buy again if I needed that capacity in an external SDD, those T9s are really quick. needed 16 TB tho lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So far it’s been reliable and has decent speed
reviews.reviewText: As a photographer, I can’t seem to have enough large capacity SSDs. I bought this when it was on sale and because the brand has proven to be reliable to me. It doesn’t seems to be quite as fast as advertised but it does the job for me. The rubber coating is good in case not gets dropped, but it is a dust a dog hair magnet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with this 4TB drive - supper fast, armored and smaller than a deck of cards.My Seagate One Touch 5TB drive ran out of capacity and it was a good drive but took "forever" (many hours) to back up my 250GB of data. I have a 2TB Samsung Touch T7 with fingerprint security that is more than 5 times faster at 1050MBS using my TBolt 4 Dell XPS 13 and the supplied TBolt 4 cable (also very happy with the T7 Touch).I decided to pay more than double the Seagate price for the 4TB Samsung T9 with advertised speeds of 2,000MBS. I didn't expect to actually gain any speed over the T7 because reviews I have read suggest more than 1,000MBS is problematic even with end-to-end TB4 hardware. However, this drive is notably faster, probably at least 50% if not more. Very happy I am not wasting more than half a day to do backups anymore. I reformatted the drive from eFat to NTFS prior to using it. I wish they made a touch version of this drive also to provide more security - I keep this one locked in a safe.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing piece of technology!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this to connect it to my Synology NAS to run Roon. They highly recommended it be run on an SSD instead of a HDD so I caved and bought it. I could have gotten something half or a quarter the capacity for a lot less and it would have worked fine, but this was a quick no-brainer.My only complaint is with Amazon and their shipping practice. They shipped this via USPS with simply a shipping label stuck to the box this device came in!!! NO anonymity or security whatsoever!! Somebody along the line could have simply grabbed this for their own use and nobody would be wiser.Thankfully the box DID arrive and it was easy to unpack. It came with two USB-C cables - one with a USB-A connector on one end, and one with a USB-C connector on the other end. A nice touch!I plugged the drive into the NAS, it found it and reformatted it in a matter of a couple seconds. My 20 TB HDD took roughly 18 hours to format in comparison! Everything is working well a day into it and I have hopes for much more enjoyment in the future! In fact, I'm eyeing that 4TB version for my portable music library so that I don't have to worry about the 5TB HDD I'm currently using getting all beat up with file errors...Prices have sure come down since I started looking at these and I'm sure, it will keep falling as capacities keep increasing!
This drive is fast, really fast.I used it as replacement drive for Tesla Model Y on HW4 with no issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Samsung has the wrong Capacity listed
reviews.reviewText: I received the 1tb model despite purchasing the 2tb model. If you look a little further at the item details you'll see that the 1tb and the 2tb capacities have been swapped. Meaning you think you're getting 2tb but really you're only getting 1.I thought this was a mistake on part of the employee who packed this box. But I can see now that is not the case. Samsung has an error in their listing. The product I sent back and asked for a replacement on is going to end up being the exact same size of 1tb. The difference in prices reflects this too. I was wondering why 2tb would be cheaper than 1tb... Do not buy this item!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy startup, worked right out of the box.
reviews.reviewText: What to say, it does everything you would expect.
Max transfer speed do not work with mac computers. Max speed is 940 mb/sMac computers do not support usb 3.2 gen 2x2

My invoice clearly states 2TB but 1TB drives received. Drive transfer rates averaged 50MB/sec. I have a Samsung X5 that operates superbly. Called Samsung tech (no email, no messaging options available). They were fixated on my computer's video card. They said to return the product.
